column4: hello all.  I have an interesting issue.  I have an acer lappy running breezy.  when I did the install I had 2x256 RAM.  Yesterday I changed to 2x512 RAM and could not boot up.  Tried 1 256 and 1 512 and no go.  tried 1 512 and no problems.  How can I add Ram without reinstalling or is it possible?
try booting memtest86 from CD or floppy with the new memory to confirm it works in a neutral environment.
so you don't even get a grub/lilo error?
I'm not sure I'm going to be much help, but for the record, what is the CPU/chipset/MB/memory type/speed?
